data.title: Christmas Gifts 2014: Bobbi Brown Makeup Sets for the Holidays
data.meta_description: Christmas Gifts 2014: Bobbi Brown Launches beauty gifts for 2014 in a special holiday collection.
data.text:
As ‘Main Hoon Na’ completes twenty years today, here’s a look at the movie's cast, how they were then and how they are now, and more.

Think you are a Bollywood buff? Try our quiz to identify class films from the 2000s based on their badly explained plots.

Ed Sheeran and Shah Rukh Khan were seen striking the actor’s iconic Bollywood pose in a viral video. Read on to know the reactions of the fans over the video.

Farah Khan is a renowned Indian film director, writer, producer, actor, dancer, and choreographer who primarily works in Hindi cinema. Khan has choreographed over a hundred songs for more than 80 films, earning the National Film Award for Best Choreography and seven Filmfare Awards for Best Choreography. Today, as she celebrates her 59th birthday, take our quiz on guessing Farah Khan’s most iconic movies like ‘Om Shanti Om,’ ‘Happy New Year,’ etc.

Shah Rukh Khan and Deepika Padukone starrer 'Om Shanti Om' turns 16 today. SRK’s charm, Deepika Padukone's mesmerising screen presence, and Farah Khan's direction make this film a must-watch for all Bollywood buffs. The film's funny sequences, memorable one-liners, and dialogues have left a lasting impression in our minds. Test your fandom of 'Om Shanti Om' with the ultimate quiz on its anniversary today. If you believe you're a true SRK fan, let's test your memory of this cult film.

A die-hard fan of KK’s soulful songs and an ardent music lover? If yes, match these chart-topping Hindi songs sung by KK by humming the lyrics of the hit tracks like ‘Ankhon Mein Teri’, ‘Koi Kahe Kehta Rahe’, and ‘Tadap Tadap’ to their correct Bollywood movies names. Take our Bollywood quiz on KK’s birthday and get a perfect score!

Zayed Khan became a household name after his memorable role as Laxman in ‘Main Hoon Na’. On his birthday today, we remember him with his famous roles in films like ‘Tezz’, ‘Dus’, ‘Yuvvraj’, etc. Match the stills to the Bollywood correct films.

Farah Khan shared actor Samantha Ruth Prabhu’s ad on her Instagram and recalled how she was criticised for marrying late and for being a woman who makes action films. She sends out a powerful message about not giving in and respecting women’s choices.

While audiences are privy only to the final cut of a film, the cast and crew on sets witness hours and hours of mistakes, retakes and bloopers. Keeping true to the recent trend of releasing behind-the-scenes footage, a number of films like ‘Pathaan’, ‘Brahmastra’, ‘JugJugg Jeeyo’ have jumped the wagon on keeping their audiences entertained beyond those 120 minutes. Here is a compilation you don’t want to miss!

Manish Malhotra was not born with a silver spoon in his mouth. Instead, he built his empire from the ground up. Today, not only is the couturier one of the biggest names in the industry, he boasts of an international clientele that can put any contemporary to shame. How did Manish Malhotra become such an indomitable force within the Indian fashion community? And how expensive are his designs? We take a detailed look.

‘Pathaan’ star Deepika Padukone has been setting makeup trends since her debut in ‘Om Shanti Om’. Here are some beauty trends the Bollywood actress set with her onscreen looks in films like ‘Love Aaj Kal’ and ‘Bachna Ae Haseeno’, be it arched long brows, winged liner, shimmer shadow, or light pink lip gloss.

Deepika Padukone and Shah Rukh Khan are unmissable in ‘Pathaan’s new song titled ‘Besharam Rang’.

Farah Khan’s magnum opus ‘Om Shanti Om’ completed fifteen years today. On this special day, she shared some interesting BTS stories from the sets of the film that we truly didn’t see coming. Here’s what she said.

Deepika Padukone and Shah Rukh Khan starrer ‘Om Shanti Om’ hit the theatres on Diwali 15 years ago, making the former an overnight star. Farah Khan’s masala film with an amazing soundtrack is still fresh in our minds so here’s a quiz for the film’s top fans.

The 2000s were a popularity contest between Shah Rukh Khan and Saif Ali Khan. Both were doing some big production films, enjoying massive fan following and working their charm like no other actors. As a Bollywood buff, who would you pick if you had to?

When Ayushmann Khurrana’s ‘Vicky Donor’ released in 2012, fans and critics immediately took notice of the debutante. The film exploded and went beyond expectations with movie watchers applauding the newbie protagonist. Bhumi Pednekar also met with the same fate when her debut film ‘Dum Laga Ke Haisha’ released. We’ve compiled a list of Bollywood actors who managed to bowl over audiences from their first films.

There are a lot of supporting roles where the characters are amazing and the audience can’t help but fall in love with them. Here are some of the best male supporting roles that we low-key wish had the lead in their movies.

Popular playback singer KK passed away due to a heart attack after performing at a concert in Kolkata on Tuesday night. Paying tribute to the versatile actor, here are his popular Hindi songs that stayed with every 90s kid.

There are many actresses who made their debut opposite Shah Rukh Khan. From Shilpa Shetty Kundra in ‘Baazigar’ to Deepika Padukone in ‘Om Shanti Om’, here’s taking a look at them and what they are doing now.

Taapsee Pannu is set to star opposite Shah Rukh Khan in Rajkumar Hirani’s new film, Dunki. She shares what it took her to finally work with the king of Bollywood. The film will release on December 22nd, 2023

Since her debut with ‘Om Shanti Om’, 36-year-old ‘Bajirao Mastani’ actress Deepika Padukone has been serving us the most glamorous makeup looks. Be it hot pink and fiery red lipsticks worn during the ‘Gehraiyaan’ promotions, or her arsenal of nude lipsticks for Indian skin tones, here are dupes of the lip shades seen on Deepika.

The day before Rishi Kapoor’s Sharmaji Namkeen release, Amazon Prime shared a video of top Bollywood celebrities dancing to his famous song Om Shanti Om to pay tribute and honour his legacy.

In an Instagram post, SRK, Deepika Padukone and John Abraham just announced the release date of ‘Pathaan’. Let’s take a look at the teaser.

Today marks 14 years since Om Shanti Om was released. If you are a fan of the movie, take this quiz to complete the dialogues.

As far as hair and makeup are concerned, films like ‘Thalaivii’ and ‘Bell Bottom’ approach beauty in a different way. While Kangana’s character looks straight out of the 60s and 70s in the former, Vaani Kapoor’s character in ‘Bell Bottom’ doesn’t sport any trendy makeup elements from the 80s. See how these films and others like ‘Om Shanti Om’ and ‘Rangoon’ show vintage, retro makeup styles and cement the setting of the story.

As per an exclusive by Bollywood Hungama, Deepika Padukone has been dropped from SLB’s Bajiu Barwa for demanding as much fee as Ranveer Singh. Click to read more.

Looking for a great pink lipstick like that worn by your favourite Bollywood actresses? We present dupes of the fuchsia, magenta, berry-pink and bubblegum lip colours spotted on Katrina Kaif in ‘Dhoom 3’, Deepika Padukone in ‘Yeh Jawani Hai Deewani’, Priyanka Chopra Jonas in ‘Gunday’, and Kareena Kapoor Khan in the ‘Veere Di Wedding’ song ‘Tareefan’.

Watching Om Shanti Om after 13 years, you’d think that the film might have lost its charm but nope, it’s still one of the finest masala films made in the last 20 years. It’s got action, drama, horror, thrill--you name it! Shah Rukh Khan and Deepika Padukone bring this reincarnation film to life.

Eyebrow makeup is a big trend now, and bushy, thick eyebrows are very trendy. From Deepika Padukone to Alia Bhatt, many leading actresses have bold brows today but many Bollywood celebrities, like Kajol and Kareena Kapoor Khan, have always had thick brows, regardless of beauty trends.

From Deepika Padukone in ‘Om Shanti Om’, Aishwarya Rai Bachchan in ‘Devdas’, Karisma Kapoor in ‘Dil To Pagal Hai’, and Sonali Bendre and Juhi Chawla in ‘Duplicate’, the heroines of Shah Rukh Khan's films shaped the beauty ideals of 90s kids. For millennials, SRK movies like ‘Veer-Zaara’, ‘Kuch Kuch Hota Hai’, and Kareena Kapoor Khan starring ‘Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham' influenced makeup trends.

There are some Bollywood movie songs that hit differently only because of their videos. From Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham to Zindagi Na Milegi Dobara, we've listed down 7 Bollywood song videos we've watched a million times.

Sometimes we just need a filmi pick-me-up after a long day, and some of these Bollywood dialogues will hit just the right spot between uplifting and inspirational.

‘Arrest Yuvika Chaudhary’ is trending on Twitter after a video of the actor using a casteist slur emerged on social media. She used the word to describe the state of her clothes while shooting a vlog.

Bollywood videos of songs popularly known as ‘item numbers’ are often very sexualised, but only when it comes to women, as exemplified by the new Radhe title track that just came out. How about we look at some music videos that sexualised men instead.

Thanks to growing up middle-class in India; it gave us unlimited opportunities to watch the following Bollywood movies. Not only have we managed to watch them a few million times, we actually use a lot of these dialogues in real-life adult situations.

An old interview of Deepika Padukone from 2009 has resurfaced, where the actress talks about how she got her start in Bollywood in Om Shanti Om, why she switched from badminton to modelling and whether she’d swap Bollywood for Hollywood.

Can you believe Deepika Padukone made her Bollywood debut 13 years ago in the Farah Khan movie Om Shanti Om, opposite none other than Shah Rukh Khan. However, DP had actually been a model before that, having abandoned her sports training in favour of modelling. Deepika first got her break as the ‘Liril’ girl, in the iconic soap ad. Take a look at some of her pictures from her modeling career.

Om Shanti Om, the film that introduced us to the Dreamy Girl Deepika Padukone, clocks 13 years today. Here’s a tough trivia quiz on the movie; let’s see if you still remember it all.

Sometimes watching your favourite Bollywood stars mess up their dialogues is a stress-buster. Since we all pretty much suck at our jobs, our compilation of movie bloopers will make you realize that on some days, even Deepika Padukone does!

Those who grew up watching Shah Rukh Khan at the peak of his career in the 90s and the early 2000s will understand this--his older films like Kuch Kuch Hota Hai, Dil Toh Pagal Hai right upto Om Shanti Om and Chak De! India could be considered classics while his recent films like Happy New Year, Dilwale and Zero cannot.

Manish Malhotra has transformed himself into a household name. Whether we can afford his designs or not, we are all lusting after them. However, before his eponymous label, he turned us into fans as a Bollywood stylist.

Before Deepika Padukone became a force to be reckoned with, she did a bunch of questionable films. From low budget but good movies to cringey characters, we’ve compiled the 8 films that perhaps even Deepika doesn’t remember being made.

Sometimes Bollywood directors make films but they forget the main ingredient--a script! We’ve compiled a list of 13 such movies where logic failed and B-town masala took over. Just how did these movies get the permission to even be made?

When Farah Khan’s Om Shanti Om released in 2007, it seemed flawless. However in 2020, a few of the plot points in the Shah Rukh Khan- Deepika Padukone starrer appear a little far-fetched. Especially the whole punarjanam thing.

Deepika Padukone has played characters that gave us some iconic looks. Be it Shantipriya’s pink kurta set from her debut Om Shanti Om or her blue dress- white overshirt combo from Tamasha, there are a few movie looks that we will not be forgetting anytime soon!

We’ve all religiously watched and followed the B-Town heroines in these superhit movies. It’s time for you to prove your fandom by matching these actresses to the movie they belong to based on their iconic outfits.

Sometimes Bollywood movies are so illogical, we’re stunned. Like how women fall for the worst guy? Today we’ve picked 10 such movies where this is the common plot point--women who’ve clearly failed to see the red flags!

The 2000s were a popularity contest between Shah Rukh Khan and Saif Ali Khan. Both were doing some big production films, enjoying massive fan following and working their charm like no other actors. As a Bollywood buff, who would you pick if you had to?
